revised_title: Tides Research: Deduction of Laws from Short Series of Observations
tldr: The author investigates whether it's possible to deduce the laws of tides from short series of observations. They analyze tide data from Plymouth and Bristol and find that a regular form and good approximation for the semimenstrual inequality can be obtained from one year's observations. The lunar parallax corrections can be determined from a series of three to four years, while the lunar declination corrections require a series of four to five years for a general form and approximate value.
